unfold verb
(OPEN)
C1 [ T ] to open or spread out something that has been folded: He watched her expression as she unfolded the letter. She unfolded a deckchair and sat down.

unfold verb
(DEVELOP)
C2 [ I ] If a situation or story unfolds, it develops or becomes clear to other people: Like a lot of people, I've watched the events of the last few days unfold on TV. As the plot unfolds, you gradually realize that all your initial assumptions were wrong.
[ T ] formal to tell a story or explain something such as a plan: Gradually, the author unfolds a fantastical tale.
